p: All tests were performed with the T. cruzi Tulahuen strain C2C4, which expresses the β-galactosidase ( LacZ) gene ( Buckner et al., 1996). L6 rat skeletal myoblasts served as host cells. Cultures were maintained in RPMI 1640 medium supplemented with 10% FBS and 1.7 µM l-glutamine at 37°C in a humidified atmosphere of 5% CO2. Host cells were seeded in 96-well microtitre plates, 2 × 10 3 per well in 100-µl medium. After 24 h, 50 µl of a suspension of 1 × 10 5/ml trypomastigote T. cruzi were added. The medium was replaced at day 4, test samples were added, and the plates incubated for further 4 d. Finally, 50 µl of 2.5× CPRG/Nonidet solution was added to all wells. A color reaction was visible within 2-6 h, which was quantified in an absorbance reader at 540 nm (Spectramax). Benznidazole was used as reference drug. Final in-test DMSO concentration did not exceed 1%. All assays were performed in two independent replicates at least.
